snippet: Spurred by the absence of an indictment in the Eric Garner case, demonstrators took to the streets in a bid to disrupt New York City’s rhythms.
abstract: Demonstrators in New York City take to the streets for third straight night in bid to raise awareness and express outrage over grand jury decision in Eric Garner case; risk that authorities will lose control lingers as protesters try to close major roadways, bridges and tunnels, and disrupt rhythms of the city.

byline.original: By MARC SANTORA and AL BAKER
byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Edna Ishayik, Daniel Krieger, Colin Moynihan, Kate Pastor, Nate Schweber and Alex Vadukul.

lead_paragraph: Spurred by the absence of an indictment in the Eric Garner case, demonstrators took to the streets in a bid to disrupt New York City’s rhythms.

headline.main: In Unpredictable New York Protests, Organized Criticism of Police
headline.print_headline: In Unpredictable Protests, Organized Criticism of Police
